value.title: DAX Fridays! #6: FILTER
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the DAX FILTER function to filter data.  Link to PBI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/filter-dax   PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-oDpOfhgmzA NEXT VIDEO:-  You can apply filters in formulas that take a table as input. Instead of entering a table name, you use the
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/SOTQ3MiTXT4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.   For example, if you want to calculate the sum of sales between two specific dates, this is the perfect function for you.  You can "hardcode" the
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Bbp-R3mLAF8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Fridays! #81: CALCULATETABLE
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function CALCULATETABLE.  CALCULATETABLE allows you to create virtual tables that you can then filter using multiple conditions and use that table to make further calculations.   What is the difference between CALCULATETABLE and CALCULATE?  The first one

value.title: DAX Fridays! #9: RANKX DAX Function
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the DAX RANKX() function to arrange your data based on criteria that you specify. value.title: Normalizing data: The what, why and how
value.excerpt: Normalizing data in Power BI: The what, why and how  When analyzing data by population, plotting the row data against the geographical location will fail to reveal important patterns when comparing countries with big differences in population and this is when it is useful to normalize the data. value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)

value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. You can now add buttons to your Power BI reports and configure actions for when they are selected.  Bookmarks and selections are a powerful combination with Power BI reports

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | Working with JSON data
